revised_title: Magnetized Electrodes and Electrical Discharge Phenomena in Rarefied Gases
tldr: The authors investigate the effects of magnetized electrodes on electrical discharge phenomena in rarefied gases. They observe that when the electrodes are oppositely magnetized, green patches on the inner glass surface vanish, and a hazy blue cloud forms between the points. A luminous ring appears within the bulb when the electrodes are magnetized, and this ring is sensitive to changes in the charge on the glass walls.
